intro: Lonchocarpus guaricensis, commonly known as the Guariçense legume, is a tropical shrub native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant is notable for its striking yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Its root system is often used in traditional medicine, though it contains toxic compounds. Due to its ecological significance and potential medicinal value, it is a subject of ongoing botanical research.
